head.title: In Lieu of Flowers; Remembering 17 Who Made a Difference

hedline.hl1: In Lieu of Flowers; Remembering 17 Who Made a Difference

abstract.p: Introduction to year-end profiles of notable Long Island residents who died in 2003; photo; drawing (M)

block.p: ''IN lieu of flowers,'' many obituary notices say, ''the family requests...''

What follows may be a suggestion for a donation to a cause supported by the person who died: a college scholarship fund, a soup kitchen, a symphony orchestra, a shelter for abandoned pets. Or perhaps the family wants to direct contributions to an organization seeking a cure for a disease. Then again, the money could go toward a more tangible monument: the planting of trees, land preserved for a park, a stained-glass window in a house of worship.
''IN lieu of flowers,'' many obituary notices say, ''the family requests...''

What follows may be a suggestion for a donation to a cause supported by the person who died: a college scholarship fund, a soup kitchen, a symphony orchestra, a shelter for abandoned pets. Or perhaps the family wants to direct contributions to an organization seeking a cure for a disease. Then again, the money could go toward a more tangible monument: the planting of trees, land preserved for a park, a stained-glass window in a house of worship.
In every case, the impulse is the same: to remember a life and remind those who survive why that life mattered.

Much the same impulse governs this annual collection of articles summing up the lives of notable Long Island residents -- some already well known, all worth knowing. Marcelle S. Fischler researched and wrote the 17 selected profiles of Long Islanders who died in 2003.
